properties.name: Oregon Zoo
properties.description: Posted by Lxk1844001 Southwest Canyon Road, Portland, OR, 97221Every time I go to a new city, I try to visit the local zoo. \'Cause I\'m cool like that. And by cool, I mean nerdy. Anyway, this was a nice small zoo. Nothing spectacular, but it had a cool wolf exhibit. And it was easy to get to (Portland has a kick butt mass transit system).

properties.name: Pied Cow
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse3244 SE Belmont St portland oregon"A little bit of hippie and a little bit of charm make for a neighborhood cafe with lasting appeal" Great desserts, fantastic in the summer (outdoor patio)

properties.name: Sapphire Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse  5008 SE Hawthorne Blvd portland orSapphire Hotel is a sexy, candlelit bar in the lobby of what was once a traveler\'s hotel and local brothel. Excellent hang out if you want just a little bit of food and a great atmosphere. Don\'t get me wrong - this place is GREAT for dinner, but the portions are small, though incredibly flavorful. Well worth the trip!

properties.name: The Courts at Beaverton
properties.description: Posted by Shawnbusse14523 SW Millikan Way beverton OrThe Courts has 6 court areas that can configure 6 Volleyball courts or 2 volleyball and 4 Basketball or any combination as needed. Each court is netted off for its own area and balls will not go into other courts. The entire courts area is all high quality hardwood maple floor that is easy on the legs and great for training and playing. The courts have open play on Friday nights, 7:00. The play is usually VERY ADVANCED. Not recommended for the beginning player.

properties.name: The Good Foot
properties.description: Posted by Kaptinqwin  2845 SE Stark St. Portland, OR 97214pinball, pool, art, music downstairs, good beer and alcohol. i strongly recommend the chicken strips and the salmon burger. watch out for pinball gangs!

properties.name: The Spare Room
properties.description: Posted by Scottysouling4830 NE 42nd Ave, Portland, 97218 The best place in Portland to go to see old people dancing to live music. I once saw some hipsters playing strip poker at a table next to mine.

properties.name: a pretty cool dog park
properties.description: Posted by Tooldiva  My dog is an avid squirrel chaser, so I prefer to bring her to a dog park that is fenced so she can have the experience of running as free as the wind. Such is the urban pooch experience. Normandale Park is great because it\'s pretty big, has lots of trees, and isn\'t a former toxic waste dump like the fenced dog areas at Delta Park and Gabriel Park. I have also met a few very nice humans in my time at Normandale who are courteous and responsible with their pets, as well as being good conversationalists. Portland still has yet to have a really great dog park like the one in Ashland or the Dr. Jose Rizal Park in Seattle. But for the time being, this one does quite well.

properties.name: crazy former bank that's now an oil painting depository
properties.description: Posted by ScottysoulingNo explanation. But some nice old guys let me inside to look around.
